verses.roman:
sapatna-madhye śocantīṁ
vṛkānāṁ hariṇīm iva
sāntvayiṣyati māṁ vākyaiḥ
pitṛ-hīnāṁś ca bālakān

synonyms: sapatna—of enemies; madhye—in the midst; śocantīm—who is lamenting; vṛkānām—of wolves; hariṇīm—a doe; iva—like; sāntvayiṣyati—will He console; mām—me; vākyaiḥ—with His words; pitṛ—of their father; hīnān—deprived; ca—and; bālakān—young boys.
translation: Now that I am suffering in the midst of my enemies like a doe in the midst of wolves, will Kṛṣṇa come to console me and my fatherless sons with His words?
